intro: Tagetes dianthifolia, commonly known as Mexican marigold, is a flowering plant native to Mexico and Central America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its vibrant yellow and orange petals. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, daisy-like flowers. Its leaves are narrow and slightly hairy, while the stems are upright and branched. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine.
